cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles south-southeast of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly tracking northwest, then north-northwest, toward the central Texas coast between Port Mansfield and San Luis Pass, with eventual stalling near the coast this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O’Connor–Matagorda Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from north of San Luis Pass to High Island (includes Galveston Island); hurricane watch south of San Luis Pass to Port Mansfield; storm-surge watch Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and portions of southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible beginning Friday with a 37 % cumulative chance and a 10 % chance of reaching 50 kt (58 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm-surge watch indicates 4–6 ft of inundation possible along the Upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches possible through early next week, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Thursday night into the weekend.
